intro: Tynanthus weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's tynanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Oleaceae family, which includes olive trees and jasmine. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a yellowish or greenish hue. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
